inn1.comm: length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone

looks to leave again, similar line, similar length, but the ball lifts alarmingly, and smacks him on the right elbow as he shoulders arms. It seems to have jarred Azhar, and he's shaking his right arm vigorously, but he looks okay to continue.
length ball, angling in from wide of the crease. Azhar shuffles across, gets outside the line of off stump, defends back towards the bowler
full outside off, Azhar gets a good stride forward to defend into the covers
full, angling down the leg side. Looks to flick, the ball clips his pad and runs down to the keeper
back of a length outside off, gets nicely behind to defend, and Panyangara starts with a maiden
full, angling in towards off stump, Shehzad blocks towards mid-off
full again, a bit wider. Shehzad goes for the drive, aiming into the covers, and the ball doesn't quite come on, rolls off the inside half towards mid-on
sees Shehzad stepping down the pitch and denies him room, bowling full, into his legs. Squeezed out awkwardly, backward of point
now Azhar steps out of his crease, and Jongwe bowls a slower ball outside off. Poked away into the covers
another slower ball, wide of off stump, beats Azhar, who stretches forward to drive. The length wasn't quite full enough

edged, and dropped! It was a length ball, angling into off stump, and Azhar came down the track and tried to whip it across the line. Ball may have stopped on him, or he may have been early into his shot, and ended up edging to John Nyumbu at second slip. Waist-high chance, simple enough, floored.
length ball angling into the pads, tucked away to long leg
fullish outside off, comes forward to push into the covers
fullish on off stump. Takes a step out of his crease and nurdles it, with the angle, towards midwicket
length ball, sixth-stump line, a bit of shape away, easily left alone
down the track, eases the wide full-toss through extra cover. They run two, but there was a one-short. Not sure at which end.
length ball, angling into off stump, tucked away with the angle through forward square leg
steps down the track, whips the off-stump ball, fairly full, to mid-on
again a big step down the track, pokes the off-stump ball towards mid-off
wide length ball, very close to the tramline outside off, left alone
blockhole ball, wide of off stump, a bit of swing away. Jabbed towards point
length ball angling in towards the off stump. Shehzad blocks to short extra cover
very full, fourth-stump line, driven into the covers
length ball angling into middle stump. Stays on the back foot and works it to midwicket. Looked like it kept a bit low
fullish outside off, presses forward and defends
shot! That's overpitched, just outside off, and Azhar leans forward and times the checked drive beautifully, to the left of the short extra cover fielder
lovely delivery, seams away from outside off, and beats the outside edge as Azhar presses forward to defend
a bit wider now and he stretches out to defend towards point
length ball outside off, a bit of away seam. Wafts at it and edges thickly to third man
fullish, wide outside off, a bit of away curl, stretches out and plays away from the body to poke it away towards point
down the track, and that's too much width from Jongwe. Azhar frees his arms and slaps that over the top, up and over cover point

Nyumbu atones for the dropped catch with a brilliant direct hit! Azhar takes a huge step down the track, and Jongwe shortens his length. He defends, and the ball runs away towards wide second slip. He didn't know where the ball had gone, and starts for a single. I think Shehzad may have said yes, and then no, and by the time Azhar turned back it was too late. Pinpoint throw from Nyumbu to catch him well short.
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
back of a length outside off, slapped crisply to point
length ball wide of off stump, left alone. Looked like he rolled his fingers over there, but the change of pace was subtle
length ball, off-stump line, blocked back to Panyangara
full and wide, and Shehzad thrashes it away through square cover. Just freed his arms and swung through the line
length ball on off stump. Pokes it into the covers, thinks about a single, decides against it
down the track, and again that's too much width. He's right up to the pitch of it, and just shows it the full face and finishes with high left elbow to pick the gap to the left of extra cover
oho, that's a soft dismissal. This wasn't as full as the previous one, and he went for the drive with his hands, not too much of a front-foot stride. Spoons it straight to mid-off
length ball angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler
angled into the pads, nudged towards midwicket
width, and Hafeez simply flows into this, drives it on the up to the cover boundary to get off the mark. Was nowhere near a half-volley
back of a length outside off. Looks to shuffle across and work it into the leg side, doesn't connect, is hit on the pads
tries to shift his length wider, ends up overdoing it and going past the tramline outside off. Hafeez has no option but to leave
full on off stump. Takes a step out of his crease, flicks with the angle to midwicket
goes wide of the crease and angles this length ball in a long way. Wasn't too far outside off, but Hafeez leaves it confidently
angled in again, finishes on a fifth-stump line, and Hafeez steers it down to third man
full outside off, driven firmly to short cover
length ball, a bit of width, stays on the back foot and chops it towards point
back of a length outside off, punched to point
full, angling into off stump, gets a big stride forward to defend back to the bowler
length ball outside off, dabbed away to third man
full on off stump, shows the full face and drives with the angle to mid-on
full, close to off stump, Hafeez plays a checked drive to mid-off
too full, too straight. Flicks the overpitched ball from a middle-stump line, easily finds the square leg boundary. Square leg umpire had to move his feet out of the way
length ball angling into off stump. Stays on the back foot, defends into the off side
overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off
slower ball wide outside off, and Jongwe has struck. Dangled it out there, and Hafeez took the bait, went hard at the drive, hit it too early, and the cover fielder took a good catch over his head
length ball outside off, comes in off the seam a touch, but it's wide enough for Malik to leave with ease
length ball angling into off stump. Sarfraz stays inside the line, looking to poke it through the off side, and ends up inside-edging into the leg side
again he tries to play it against the angle, staying inside the line of an off-stump ball. Chops it into the pitch, nearly plays on
a bit more width this time, and Sarfraz can safely steer it down to third man
back of a length close to off stump. Malik goes back and across to defend
back of a length outside off, defended into the off side
fuller now, looks to drive through the off side but the slowness of the pitch causes him to drag it to mid-on
length ball outside off. Sarfraz takes a big step across with his front foot and works that into the midwicket region
length ball, fourth stump line. Comes forward to defend, sees it seam away, and tucks his bat behind his pad to leave it
length ball angling into middle stump, worked away to the left of long leg
fullish outside off, presses forward and punches it back to the bowler
slower ball, back of a length, sixth-stump line. Leaves it alone and the ball bounces a second time before reaching the keeper
back of a length, angling into off stump. Takes a big step across to work it through the leg side but the midwicket fielder moved quickly to his right to cut that off
back of a length, angling into off stump. Stays on the back foot and defends right below his eyes
full on off stump, angling in, driven to mid-on
fullish, angling into middle stump, clipped straight to midwicket
length ball close to off stump. Sarfraz lets it come on and dabs it down to third man
full, angling in, hits Malik on the pads as he misses a flick. Loud appeal, not given. Yup. Looked like it was angling down leg
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and pokes it towards point
slower ball on middle and leg, tucked quietly to midwicket
slower bouncer, loops into the keeper's gloves after Sarfraz ducks under it
takes two big strides down the pitch, tries to work an off-stump ball through the leg side, can't connect, is hit on the front pad
full on off and middle, flicked away to deep square leg
full outside off, presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
slower ball, angled too far down the leg side. Malik can't make contact while trying to work it into the leg side
full outside off, stretches out to play a checked drive to mid-off
length ball angling into off stump, presses forward and defends with soft hands

oh my. That was a loopy slower ball, ended up going into the keeper's gloves on the full. Sarfraz flashed at it outside off and the ball sailed over his outside edge. Mutumbami took the bails off in a hurry, but replays showed Sarfraz had dragged his foot back in time.
fullish on middle stump, comes forward and clips it into the gap between midwicket and mid-on
on the pads, tucked away to square leg
wide length ball, gets down low and slaps it to point
starts with a horrible full-toss. Loopy, waist-height, and Malik clubs it away to the square leg boundary. No-ball.
Malik is down the track even though there isn't too much flight, and he launches it high and straight, and that might have gone out of the ground. Absolute monster hit.
lovely flighted legbreak on off stump. Comes forward to defend, and it turns and squirts off the outside edge wide of slip
short outside off, gets on the back foot to slap to sweeper cover
full on middle and leg, comes forward and  pokes it to mid-on, who's deep enough to allow the quick single
loopy legbreak outside off, comes forward and drives to cover
tossed up outside off, comes forward and places the checked drive to the left of the cover fielder
back of a length outside off, chopped away down to third man
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
full slower ball outside off stump, opens his bat face and squeezes it down to third man
back of a length, fourth-stump line, chopped down to third man
shortish outside off, opens his bat face and plays it finer this time, far enough to the left of the third man fielder to pick up two
flighted ball outside off, driven quietly to sweeper cover
length ball outside off, not much turn, but Sarfraz still manages to steer it down to third man, plays that nice and late
flighted outside off, presses forward and blocks it to short cover
a bit quicker now, driven to short cover
loopier and a bit wider this time, stretches out to drive, ends up slicing it to backward point
fullish on middle and leg, clipped away to the right of mid-on
back of a length on off stump, whips it with the angle to midwicket
length ball outside off, presses forward to block it back towards the bowler
full slower ball on off stump, angling in from wide of the crease. Malik comes forward to smother it
short and wide, but no pace on it at all, and Malik can only slap it straight to point
back of a length on off stump, whipped to midwicket
looks to clip this leg-stump ball through the on side, but it's a legcutter and he sends it rolling off the leading edge towards cover
tossed up on off and middle. Sarfraz brings out his favourite sweep down to the man at deep backward square leg
length ball outside off, stretches out to play a checked drive to sweeper cover
down the track, meets this loopy ball on the full, drags it from outside off, straight to mid-on

another sweep, and that is beautifully done. It was turning from middle to off, but he was at full stretch, got his head right over the ball, and absolutely hockey-slapped that to the square leg boundary
flatter and quicker, tucked off the pads through square leg
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
full, angling into the pads, clipped away to deep square leg
back of a length, fourth-stump line, and Sarfraz plays that dab down to third man once again
back of a length outside off, poked away to third man
full on middle stump, driven firmly down the ground and Jongwe has to dive to his left to stop it at mid-on
shortish outside off, and Malik plays another dab down to third man
length ball outside off, and Sarfraz plays the fine dab again, this time off the front foot, and places it to the left of third man and picks up two
length ball outside off. Sharpish turn, and Malik jabs away from his body, the edge nearly carries to slip
shorter now, and he makes a bit of room to slap it to sweeper cover
full outside off, driven to short extra cover
flat, angling into the pads, pushes it with a straight bat towards mid-on
tossed up wide of off stump, stretches out and pushes it into the covers

ooh. Angles it in from wide of the crease, and Malik comes forward, looking to work it with the angle. The ball turns away sharply, beats his bat, and squeezes away between the keeper and the diving slip fielder
length ball on middle stump, clipped away nicely through straight midwicket, lovely timing from Sarfraz, wasn't looking to hit it too hard
length ball wide of off stump and that is agricultural from Malik, but very effective. Takes a big step across with his front leg and swipes it into the gap to the right of mid-on
shortish, fourth-stump line, slapped to point
back of a length outside off, and there's that third-man dab again
fullish outside off, comes forward to punch firmly to extra cover
Looks to sweep a length ball from outside off, misses, the ball hits him on the body
shortish outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
flat, angling into middle stump. Looks to make room to play through the off side but it isn't short enough for that. Ends up poking at it defensively
fuller now, driven down the ground to long-off
flat and full wide of off stump, stretches out to defend into the covers
flat, a touch short, comes in with the angle towards off stump, punched to sweeper cover
flat, angling into leg stump, tucked away to long leg
length ball on off stump, driven down to long-on
quickish length ball turning in towards off stump, defended off the back foot

bowled him! Jumped down the track, and slogged in a rather unedifying manner, across the line, his head swivelling all over the place. A touch of Javagal Srinath about that shot. Good ball from Nyumbu too, it went above the batsman's eyeline and dipped below it quickly. Snappy flight, and it turned in sharply from outside off to knock back middle stump
length ball turning into middle and leg, tucked quietly into the leg side
nice flight outside off, quick flight again, and Rizwan skips down nimbly and presses forward to defend into the off side
full on off stump, pushed back to the bowler with a turn of the wrists
fullish on off stump, driven with the turn to sweeper cover
beauty. Went with the arm towards middle stump as Rizwan pressed forward to defend, playing for turn. Bowler aborted his lbw appeal because he realised there was an inside edge
a bit wider in line and Rizwan drives to sweeper cover
length ball outside off, steered off the front foot to sweeper cover
full on off stump, blocked to short extra cover
short and wide, and that's slapped away easily to the point boundary
tossed up outside off, driven with the turn to midwicket
back of a length, sharp turn in towards off stump, defended studiously back to the bowler
back of a length, turns down leg, worked away to deep square leg
lots of flight wide outside off, and he plays a firm-flat batted drive, forcing Chigumbura to dive to his left to stop it at cover
length ball, turning down leg, Rizwan tucks it away towards short fine leg
down the track and Williams quickens his pace. Presses out to defend and it pops up off his front pad into the leg side
a bit slower through the air, Sarfraz drives it down the ground to long-on
length ball outside off, Rizwan gets on the front foot, lets the ball come to him, and dabs it wide of slip with an open bat face
Rizwan skips nimbly down the track to this flighted ball outside off, drives into the covers
quicker now, poked into the covers, thinks of a single, decides against it
floated up, angling into leg stump. Rizwan gets his front foot out of the way and drives to long-off
back of a length, turning in from outside off, pokes it towards point off the back foot
a bit of flight outside off and he presses forward to block into the covers
a bit wider outside off and Rizwan gets his front foot across and defends towards point
length ball outside off and he opens his bat face to push it into the gap to the right of backward point
length ball outside off, defended into the covers
full on middle and off, driven with a straight bat to midwicket
flat, back of a length close to off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
shorter now, flat-batted to sweeper cover
down the track, and Williams tries to follow him by firing it into his feet. Sarfraz's feet are too quick, though, and he moves his front leg nimbly out of the way to whip it up and over midwicket
tossed up outside off, presses forward and pushes it to the left of the short cover fielder
full on off and middle, driven inside-out to short extra cover, where Raza makes a diving stop
slower now, looped up outside off, swept away to deep square leg

wow. Rizwan skipped down the track to the first ball of the over, and Nyumbu bowled a similar ball to the one that dismissed Malik. Unlike Malik, Rizwan played it with a straight bat, and got a full extension of his arms to launch that high over long-on
tossed up outside off, driven to short cover

there's the sweep again, goes for it from outside off, and there's a bit of extra bounce, causing him to top-edge it. Panyangara ran in from long leg to try and grab it, and dived forward, but the ball fell just short
nice flight, wide of off stump. Sarfraz goes for the drive, a wafty attempt, and the ball dips and beats his edge
looks to sweep again, a touch shorter than ideal length, and the ball bounces up to hit him on his shoulder
full and wide and he eases a drive out to sweeper cover

down the track comes Sarfraz, and that wasn't the wisest shot to play. Cremer straightened his line, forcing the batsman to hit over the leg side, and Sarfraz took him on, and picked out the man at deep midwicket
flighted ball outside off, defended into the covers
now the googly, cramps Rizwan who's looking to cut. Jams down on it at the last moment to block it into the off side
a bit slower and more flighted, brings him forward to defend into the covers
a touch short, skids through with the angle, cramps Rizwan, who looks to pull and ends up playing it to mid-on
more flight this time and he sweeps it down to deep backward square leg
appeal for caught behind, not given. Nyumbu gets it to dip on Rizwan as he comes forward and looks to work it leg side, and it turns in and pops up off the front pad to the keeper
sweeps, sweeps well, down to deep square leg
fullish on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
full on middle and leg, gets his front foot out of the way to drive inside-out to cover
length ball, turns from middle to off, blocked safely into the off side
dangerous, not short or wide enough to cut, manages to play it from almost in front of off stump, can't beat short third man
length ball on middle and off, swept away to deep square leg
length ball on middle and leg, stays on the back foot and plays with a straight bat down to long-on
tossed up outside off, driven towards sweeper cover
short outside off, looked like the googly, only ended up giving Wasim more width, and he cracked it away off the back foot, to the cover point boundary
full-toss outside off, driven to mid-off
tossed up on middle and off, clipped away with the turn to deep square leg
starts the over with a fullish ball down the leg side and Williams has to scramble to his left at the backward square leg boundary to stop Wasim's firm sweep
shortish outside off, punched into the covers, where Raza swoops quickly to his right to cut off the chance of a single
short and wide, eased away off the back foot to the right of sweeper cover
length ball, turns from leg to off, defended watchfully off the front foot
full on leg stump, tucked away quietly to midwicket
short outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
low full-toss outside off, whipped away to long-on
full on off stump, driven inside-out to sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, whipped with the turn to long-on

tossed up outside off, and that is nicely done by Rizwan, gets down low to sweep, has to fetch it from a long way outside off, and hit against the turn, but he plays it beautifully and finds the midwicket boundary
length ball outside off, presses forward to push gently into the covers
full on off stump, clipped with the turn through backward square leg
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
quickish length ball on off stump, defended back to Nyumbu
turns into the pads and Raza swoops at midwicket to deny the single after Rizwan flicked it towards him
loopy delivery wide outside off, whipped with the turn to long-on
short outside off, jabbed away towards sweeper cover

shot! That's just a touch short outside off, and even though it's turning sharply into off stump, Rizwan has time to make room and open his bat face and place that extremely fine, inches to the right of the keeper and find the boundary. Hamilton Masakadza, chasing back from short third man, had no chance of stopping it.
tossed up on off stump, clipped down to long-on
tries to repeat the shot he played off the last ball of the previous over, but Williams has bowled this much quicker and it's past his edge very quickly
fuller now, gets forward to poke it into the off side
short outside off, punched to sweeper cover
flighted ball outside off, clipped quietly off the front foot to deep square leg
short outside off, slapped away to deep point
tossed up outside off and that's another powerful sweep from Rizwan, Panyangara had to chase a fair distance from long leg and dive to his left to stop that
goes for the sweep again, a touch shorter than ideal length, and he edges it into his pad, and the ball balloons over the keeper and into the fine leg region
quickish length ball outside off, presses forward to poke into the covers and call his partner through for a single
quick length ball outside off, comes forward to play into the covers, the ball turns in and forces him to defend with soft hands, drops down into the leg side
a touch shorter and he makes room to cut that towards deep point
shortish outside off, lets it come on and cuts late, but can't beat short third man
tossed up on off stump, driven down to long-off
back of a length outside off, dabbed to backward point
fuller now, gets forward to clip it from outside off, with the turn, towards square leg
length ball turning into the pads, clipped away to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, clipped away into the vacant midwicket area, and Williams has to chase the ball in his follow-through
back of a length outside off, punched to extra cover
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man
down the track, and he looks to hammer that shortish slower ball down the ground, can only swipe it back towards the bowler, who gets a hand to it and deflects it to mid-on
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away through square leg
slower ball, full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
fullish on off stump, whipped in the air, falls well short of long-on
full-toss, whipped from off stump towards deep midwicket
appeal for lbw as this quickish ball turns in sharply from outside off and hits the front pad as Wasim looks to whip through the leg side. Seemed to strike him outside the line
full outside off, driven to extra cover
quick and full on off stump, and Rizwan gets his feet out of the way to drive inside-out to sweeper cover
turns into the pads and Wasim can't beat square leg with his flick
back of a length on middle and off, goes back and across to work it into the fine leg region
flat and quick outside off. Goes for the sweep and misses, hits him on the front pad
back of a length close to off stump. Lets it come on and dabs it softly towards point
slower ball on off stump. Wasim clears his front leg and flat-bats it firmly but can't beat mid-off
on the pads now and he whips it away to deep square leg
fullish on middle and off, swiped down the ground to long-on
full on middle and leg, whipped down to long-on
slower ball outside off, angling across the left-hander, and that is a super shot, a flick-cum-sweep to the backward square leg boundary
length ball outside off, opens his bat face to steer to short third man
tossed up outside off, goes for the lap-sweep, doesn't get it right. Ends up sending it rolling towards square leg
down the track to the wide ball outside off, drives towards point
on the pads now, tucked away through square leg
full-toss on leg stump, swept away to the right of deep square leg
low full-toss outside leg stump, and Williams is lucky Rizwan couldn't place his sweep wide of Chigumbura at short fine leg
shortish outside off, slapped away to deep point
flat, shortish ball on middle stump, no real room to punch and he can't beat cover
short outside off, flat-batted to the right of long-off
in the blockhole, angling down leg. Wasim looked to clear his front leg and hit over the top and it snuck under his bat and hit his pad
length ball angling into middle and leg, swiped away to deep midwicket
tossed up wide of off stump, full toss, driven to sweeper cover
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away quietly through midwicket, and deep midwicket has to come in a long way to field that. Rizwan picks up two easily and gets to his half-century.
length ball on leg stump, tucked away to deep midwicket
bouncer, has to fetch the pull from outside off, sends it bouncing down to long-on
length ball outside off and that is superbly done. Gets his front leg across and his head down low and shovel-sweeps it over short fine leg
in the blockhole outside off, whipped away towards long-on
low full-toss on off stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
full-toss on the pads, clipped away towards deep square leg
full outside off and Wasim shuffles across and sweeps to square leg
slower bouncer outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
full-toss outside off, flat-batted down to long-off
slower ball, sees Rizwan jumping out of his crease and making room, and bowls it wide outside off. Can only flat-bat it down the ground to long-off
shuffles across to the wide yorker and jabs it away into the cover region

dropped. Bouncer angled across the left-hander, and Wasim has to pull that from over his left shoulder. Doesn't control it, hits it in the air, and Williams, running to his left from long-on, puts down an easy chance. He's hurt his webbing as well.
full on off stump, clears his front leg to swipe to mid-off
short ball on middle stump, pulled away towards deep square leg, and Rizwan picks up another double
sees Rizwan making room and looks to go for the wide yorker outside off. Ends up overdoing it and the ball barely landed on the pitch
low full-toss on middle stump, looks to scoop it over the bowler, toe-ends it, and barely gets any distance on it. Raza has to run in a long way from long-on to field that after two bounces

what a shot that is! Shaped for the lap-sweep, and Panyangara sent down a low, middle-stump full-toss. Realising the angle was against him, he switched the angle of his bat and played a reverse-lap-sweep instead, to find the gap to the right of short third man. Brings up his fifty too.
slower bouncer outside off, tennis-smashed down to mid-off
looks for the wide yorker, and it's far out of reach of Wasim, who can only leave. Looks at the umpire, who doesn't signal wide

action replay of the previous ball, and this time the umpire does signal wide. Wasim had moved across his crease a long way, and had exposed all his stumps, and the bowler still sent one down that was out of his reach
full outside off, flat-batted down to long-off
slower short ball on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket

went across his crease and exposed all his stumps again, giving the bowler two options - aim at the stumps or follow the batsman. Jongwe followed, and Wasim swung the length ball up towards deep midwicket, Cremer. The fielder caught it, but was overbalancing over the rope, and had no option but to flick it away as he did so
wide yorker, looks to chop down on it, can't make contact
again he moves across and exposes his stumps. Jongwe bowls the wide yorker, and Wasim tried to lap-sweep, only managing an inside-edge that rolled through to the keeper

length ball on off stump, and Wasim, who's shuffled all the way across his stumps, plays an effortless pick-up sweep and sends it sailing over backward square leg. Did that carry all the way? Nope. One bounce and over the rope
wide yorker, and this time Wasim hadn't gone across his stumps, meaning it was definitely too far out of his reach, and the umpire had to signal wide
low full-toss outside off, sliced away to deep point

in the blockhole, and Rizwan, who had moved across his stumps, had no room as he tried  to whip it leg side. Inside-edged into his toe, and it flew to the right of the diving keeper and ran away to the boundary
slower ball on off stump, it's a low full-toss, and Rizwan gets down on one knee for the slog-sweep. Doesn't quite time it, but he just eludes the leaping mid-on fielder

tries to make room and Panyangara bowls it wide outside off. Leaves it, and it's called wide. They try to sneak a bye as well, and Mutumbami kicks the ball into the stumps at the batsman's end, finds Wasim short of his crease. End of a superb partnership.
slower ball outside off. Yamin goes for the cover drive, drags it out towards mid-on off the inside half of his bat
full-toss outside off stump and Rizwan opens up and swivels at the hip to launch it high over the bowler, just about clears the rope to finish the innings with a six.

inn2.comm: lbw appeal straight up, nervous times for Chari. He has lost his balance trying to defend a pretty quick, pretty full delivery. Struck on the pad first, but it had pitched outside leg. Chari better buck up, those reactions were too slow
quick to judge the line when the length is shorter, easy leave outside off

lovely start from Irfan, and the Pakistan slip cordon knows it. Immediate and healthy encouragement as they watch this indipper pitch just back of a length and just outside off. Chari trusts the bounce and leaves

another scary lbw appeal, because Chari is slow on his shot again. Thankfully for him, it pitched outside leg again. Brilliant mixing of length from the tall fast bowler. This is full again, leaves him no time to think
a shade slower from Irfan, might have been the offcutter? Not quite sure. Pulls Chari forward to block but beats him on the angle
a little shaky again mostly because of the pace of Irfan. Accurate fast bowler to exploit the nerves of a debutant. This back of a length delivery on off stump is defended to point
inauspicious start as he sends down a harmless delivery way outside off
seems to be one of those bowlers who gets the ball to skid along. Short run-up, uses the angle into the right hander and makes him block into the covers
just a shade short again, although he is targeting a nice stump-to-stump line, defended
covers the line of a shortish delivery on of stump and nudges it towards midwicket
goes wide of the crease, Chibhabha knocks it gently to mid-on and he has rushed down to the other end. First runs off the bat
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with

a thick little inside edge gets Chari off the mark in ODIs. Looks for a push to mid-on like his partner had earlier in the over, but the angle into him is a bit too acute. Ends up getting a couple past square leg
keeps back in his crease as he picks up the shorter ball early and dabs it square into the off side
pushed across the right-hander, perhaps just a touch of movement away as well. Chibhabha has judged it early and leaves it well alone
jumps off his toes to get on top of the bounce of another short, rising delivery on middle and off. Tucks it towards midwicket
short and wide and asking to be hit, Chibhabha goes for it but has not made any connection.

top edge thuds straight onto the advertising triangles at third man, probably six? Ah, just fell short. Just the sheer pace from Irfan. It has beaten the batsman who is ages late on the pull, but he will get the boundary any way
chops a shortish delivery outside off through to deep third man
short and wide, Chibhabha missed out on one in the last over and he cannot do much more in this either. Mistimes a cut into the covers
a little bit of aggression, but that time the ball was not quite wide enough to free his hands. Yamin angles the ball into the right-hander, pulls to midwicket
presents the straight bat and punches into the covers
pushes it full and just outside off, Chibhabha is a little reluctant to come forward, having been fed back of a length deliveries. Inside edges a push down the pitch
short and outside off, chopped to point
goes for the cut again, but he cannot pick the gap at point. Yamin sneaks in a maiden

oh dear, he was sucked in by the left-armers angle. And a bit of extra bounce, no surprise that from Irfan, takes the outside edge even as the batsman was trying to leave the ball alone at the very last second
stays deep in his crease, lets the short ball come on on middle stump and nudges it towards midwicket
fullish and just outside off, Chibhabha pushes to mid-off and runs
thats well left. Picked the shortish ball, knew the angle across him is threatening, and drops his wrists
chops down on a wide yorker, just not quick enough to match Irfans pace
a slightly slower, shortish delivery on middle and leg. Chari waits for it and blocks into the covers
half-volley, lovely drive, seems to have got his timing going. But the placement is still wanting. Picks out cover
back of a length on off stump, defended
short of a length and just outside off, Chibhabha punches towards extra cover. Rizwan cuts across, dives to his right and prevents the single
eased towards point off the open face
timing, check. Placement, double check. And this wasnt even a half-volley. Wades into a good length ball, which was if anything a bit too wide, and crunches it through extra cover. Nobody moved

makes the correction straight away and hopes he has gotten lucky. Yamin throws an lbw appeal at the umpire as Chibhabha plays around good length ball angled sharply in at him. But it would have missed leg stump
full and wide, Chari steers it towards point where Shehzad has to put in a dive to his right
sends down another short ball, this time from around the wicket, Chari gets in line with it
good length ball on middle, kept out
sways away from the line of the bouncer, good technique from Chari. Eyes on the ball, wrists down and tucked close to his body
goes to block a jolly old full toss, and comes out with an inside edge.
another maiden, when it really shouldnt have been. Shortish delivery on off stump, blocked by his feet
good length searching for the top of off, Chibhabha defends it
full and slanted down leg, Chibhabha was looking for the heave ho over fine leg, but does not connect
forced past mid-off, but it does not have the power to beat him completely
inside edges onto his pads as Yamin continues angling back of a length balls into the right-hander. No room given
sliced away past point. Lots of bottom hand strength there from Chari. Eases back back and picks the gap to the left of the fielder. Opened the face to make sure he got maximum result
back of a length and just outside off, blocked
width outside off and this time he has an easier job cutting the ball. Finds deep third man, but makes up for it by taking a couple

strikes first ball! Went back in his crease, hoping to give himself a little more time to pick the ball away through midwicket. But the ball skids on and foils all that. Strikes him in line with the stumps, the only question might be if the ball would just carry on down leg. The umpire doesnt think so, however
eases forward to try and get to the pitch, nudges towards midwicket
good length ball outside off, Masakadza lunges forward and blocks
pushed through down the leg side, Hami M thinks about a little leg glance, but instead collects the wide
tossed up on leg stump, defended
driven past the bowlers left as Hami M takes the invitation of the flighted delivery
strays on the pads, Chari clips to the right of midwicket and sets off. His partner though is a little less certain. Could have been a run-out. But Masakadza has put his skates on just in time
width outside off and Chari is happy to turn it into a single to third man. Lovely little dab
shortish and holds up on the pitch, Masakadza has to adjust to it. Softens his hands and blocks towards cover
punched back down the pitch as he continues hitting back of a length on middle
full on off stump, Masakadza steps forward to block
short of a length and outside off, pushed into the covers
outside edge as Masakadza looks to bully a fullish ball outside off. Lashed out at it, but has to settle for a single to third man
flighted on middle and leg, driven back at the bowler
goes on with the arm, Masakadza looks to block, gets an inside edge and picks up a single behind square leg
tossed up on middle, straightens just a touch as well. Chari, courtesy a good front foot stride, defends
misfield from Yasir at point, even as Sarfraz called out "Easy". Chari escapes to the other end with a little slice
tossed up on middle and leg, flicked to midwicket
pushed through on middle, Hami M is back and blocks
hangs an open face outside off, looking for a single to third man. Cannot connect
full and wide outside off, has to reach out and gets it off the very bottom of the bat. Has enough power on it to beat mid-off running back
good length ball on middle and off, defended
offcutter, but he had given it away too early. Chari waits for it and dabs it to third man
sweetly driven past a diving short cover fielder. A touch too full and wide from Yamin
good length ball, seems to straighten just a tad, Chari defends and gets an outside edge
slower through the air, tossed up on leg stump, Hami M whips it to midwicket
well done. The plan seems to be to tuck the batsman on middle and leg. But with long-on back, Hami M secures an early single
stays back to a good length ball, slightly quicker as well, defended

turn! Outside edge beaten. Wasim held that back and had the batsman searching for it. Chari was on the front foot, but not to the pitch, then he commits the mistake of following the ball with his hands. Lucky not to nick off. Good take from Sarfraz too
fired in outside off, driven through the covers
lovely batting, zips down the track and nudges to long-on again to retain strike
keeps back to a rather fuller delivery outside off, Hami M is good enough to adjust though. Pats it towards cover
but it doesnt take too long for Yasir to pose his threat. Loopy legspinner tempts Hami M into a big drive, but it dips and sneaks below his bat
tossed up outside off, driven through the covers
good length ball outside off, Chari guides it to point

googly? No, just goes on with the arm. Chari has not picked it. He has, however, provided ample gap between bat and pad. Lovely bowling from Yasir, and he celebrates with a big ol smile. Chari had lunged forward looking for the one going away, as such his hands are leading away from his body. The ball though pitches and moves just enough the other way to breach his defences
pushed through on middle, Williams is rooted at the crease and just about manages to block
good length ball just outside off, seemed to have come back in a shade as well. Defended through the covers for a single. Oh, and it is a no-ball as well.
slower ball that follows the batsman who was making room outside leg, Williams drags it away to long-on
lovely drive from Hami M again. As well as he had struck that though, he cannot get much for it. Straight down the ground and close enough for the bowler to get a hand to it
loud appeal for lbw, but this might just have picked outside leg. Hami M did not look good, caught in the crease and playing around his pads. Hit him on the top flap too. Enough doubt
back of a length and just outside off, defended

another leg-before appeal, this one perhaps slightly closer. Wahab certainly thinks so. Pitched in line, rapped Hami M on the knee-roll too. But perhaps it might just have gone past off stump. Maybe did not come back enough. But geez, that was close!
a shade short and WIlliams goes for the pull and has placed it well enough wide of square leg to scamper a couple of runs
flighted outside off, but Hami M prefers the safety of his back foot. Glided to short third man
loads more flight on this and absolutely no room, so Hami M whips it back at the bowler
a little width outside off, driven through the covers
tossed up outside off, Williams is forward and plays a deft little sweep past the short leg fielder. Gently done, only looking for a single
just a shade short, Hami M goes for the pull but the ball has not bounced as much. Mistimes to short midwicket
flighted just outside off, driven to mid-off
full on middle and leg, driven to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Williams uses that and runs it down to third man

only one slip in place and Pakistan might just rue that. He was not all that certain in his attempted block, but in a way that may have helped him since he did not push at the ball too hard and the ball went down quickly. Too wide for first slip to be in the game. Four runs to third man
short and wide, flayed through the covers
solid backfoot punch from Williams, had ample time to play it too. He is a pressure batsman, Williams. Would not be all that perturbed by the rising run-rate
half stop from Rizwan at short cover, who is wearing shin pads underneath his trousers.Single taken though, after Hami M plays another strong drive on the up outside off

stayed just a touch low, although this is more a misjudgment from the batsman. Rocked back trying to go for a pull, but it wasnt quite short enough for that. Hami M realises that and tries to save face with a straight bat. Just not quick enough. With a free passage - the batsman had backed away to enable his shot - Yasir gets the ball to crash into middle
jumps down the track and drives down to long-off
tossed up just outside off, Williams lunges forward to block
flatter delivery outside off, Williams looks to thump it to long-on, but Yasir gets in the way
did not reach the pitch and may have been in a little trouble had that ball went on with the arm. But it was the legspinner, Williams had picked that much at least, and blocks
drives the overpitched delivery on middle to long-on
short of a length on off stump, inside edged onto his pads
solidly behind the shortish delivery on off stump, finds cover though
eased off the open face to deep point as Wahab continues with his staple short of a length deliveries
full on off stump, Raza defends to point
full and outside off, driven smartly to deep cover
strays on the pads, Williams clips it away to long leg
lifted over the head of the bowler, but good work from Imad at the long-on boundary keeps it to two. Picks up the slower, overpitched delivery and controlled it well
tossed up outside off, Williams strides forward to blunt it
pushed calmly to long-on. Williams doing things nicely, just needs some support at the other end

huge appeal for leg-before. And while that excitement was going on, the ball only just about missed leg stump! Raza was so far across outside off, and was struck in line with off stump. The only thing that would have saved him from the lbw was if he had hit it
flighted outside off, driven to long-off
crunched to point as Raza gets behind a short ball outside off
back of a length and outside off, Raza is reaching for it with the open face and gets it to point
tapped to the right of mid-off and with Raza calling early and Williams responding straight away, the fielder is put under pressure and it results in a misfield from Malik
back of a length on middle, picked away to square leg
tucks him up on middle and leg, Raza bunts it to the right of Wahab
absorbs the pace of this short delivery on off stump and defends down the pitch
lbw appeal. Ample turn on the leggie, but although it did hit Williams low enough in front of middle and leg, he had taken a long stride out and it would have gone down leg
skips down the track and yorks himself . Still manages to get a single through the covers
driven past mid-off
chipped, but falls short of the onrushing long-on. Did look dangerous for a moment, but Williams has not put as much power behind the stroke.
gets down the track and whips a good length ball away to long-on.
flighted on leg, Williams pulls out his trusty sweep and gets a couple
pushed through on middle and leg, Raza rocks back to force it away past the bowler on his left. Wasim manages to catch up with it
tossed up on middle and leg, worked away to long-on
a little short and outside off, punched to mid-off
mid-off was up, this was overpitched. Opportunity seen, opportunity converted. Lunges forward to the pitch of it and lofts it sweetly over the bowlers head. No slogging. Just a super cricket shot
flatter delivery on middle and leg, picked away to long leg
fired in on middle, Raza makes room but cant get the gap in the covers
looped up down the leg side, Williams pushes to long-on
stays around to the right-hander too, and lobs up a full toss. Raza bunts it back at the bowler, and it is in the air too. Just falls short of Malik and gives him a little shiner on the ankle
some turn for Malik as he hits a good lenght on middle and leg. Defended
strays a bit too far down leg, Raza picks out short fine leg with his clip

drags it short and Raza has taken full toll. Awful delivery, gave the batsman lots of time to camp back and pick the gap. Raza placed it well to the right of midwicket, and although the fielder gave a great chase - he dived and got a hand to the ball - it is in vain
punched down to long-on
misjudged an arm ball on middle and leg, but Raza has adjusted well enough to get an inside edge as he defends
a little short and wide too, slapped through the covers
fired in on off stump, Williams goes back and blocks solidly
strays down the pads as he continues bowling short, picked away to deep backward square leg
good length ball on middle, pushed to short cover
speared in on leg stump, Raza pats it through to long-on
tossed up on off stump, Raza defends to mid-off
steps down, but Malik shortens his length. Raza stays calm and clips it behind square leg

goes for the big hit to the wrong ball and he is done in. Shakes his head and slaps his bat down on the turf in disappointment. Lulled by the flight of the ball (or lack ot) Thought he could reach the pitch. He couldnt and with him committed to playing across the line - as it happens with most sweep shots - he cannot connect and watches his middle stump take a hit
gets down the track and drives towards mid-on. Only Rizwan at short midwicket intervenes. Electric in the field he is, and gets a playful pat down by Malik because his uniform got dusty
goes on with the arm on middle and off, Raza gets a thick outside edge to short third man
tossed up on middle, defended
flatter delivery outside off stump, slid to backward point
that time Chigumbura gets the gap through the covers to convert a short delivery outside off into some runs
flighted on middle, kept out
fired in on off stump, Raza was backing away and Wasim thought he could have broken through his defences too. Doesnt happen. Single through the covers
good length ball on middle and leg, defended
pushed through on the pads, Chigumbura clips it to deep square leg
gently whipped to long-on after Chigumbura got down the track to the pitch of a good length ball on leg stump
a little more flight and a little more angle across the right-hander from around the stumps. Eased through point
defends a length ball on middle and leg
fired in on middle, defended past the leg gully that has just been put in place
that leg slip means Malik will have to target leg stump. Chigumbura tries to fiddle with those plans by pulling out a sweep. Does not connect well enough
tossed up outside off, defended
stays back to a flat and quick delivery on middle and punches to long-off
very late in bringing his bat down, but he does bring down a straight one. The arm ball from Wasim is pushed to long-on. Just about
slides down the track to another slider on the pads, the inside edge is beaten and he is struck on the pads and it is deflected away into the off side
turn! Not often has that happened in this innings, but this time it is enough to beat Raza outside off. Pitched and angled in on middle, the batsman comes forward to block but connects only with air
good length ball outside off, defended
tossed up on leg stump, Raza takes a late decision not to push-drive as hard and nearly pops a catch to the bowler
steps down the track and drives down the ground. Malik does well in his followthrough to get a hand to it
good length ball just outside off, defended
length ball down the leg side, Chigumbura goes for the sweep but it is too wide

loads of turn again! And some bounce too. It wasnt flighted or anything. Just a quick offbreak with lots of revs. Pitches on middle and leg, the batsman was making room to try and cut the ball, but ends up smothering it against his thigh pad off the inside edge
pushed through down leg again, second wide of the over
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on
defends a flatter delivery on off stump towards midwicket
tossed up on the stumps, picked away to long-on
good length ball making him reach outside off, defended

races down the track for a huge heave over the leg side. Awful shot with his team already in trouble. More comes their way as the outside edge settles in the hands of short third man. May have just held that one back on middle to fool the charging batsman
fired down leg, Mutumbami picks it away to deep square leg
good length ball on middle, Chigumbura defends
loopy delivery, a lot slower too, outside off, Chigumbura looks for the release with a big drive down the ground. Does not beat the bowler

that certainly was the googly and the batsman had no idea. Was backing away, expecting the ball to turn after pitching on off stump and looking for the cut shot. But it grips in the pitch and rears back at him. Top-class bowling from Yasir
targets outside leg stump, swept easily past the leg gully
stays back to block a good length delivery on off stump
tossed up on middle, Mutumbami steps out of his crease and drives
loads of flight this time outside off, Mutumbami drives to mid-off
opens the face and slides a flighted delivery through point
length on the pads, picked away through midwicket
goes back and punches a short delivery outside off to long-on

he has four, and he owes it to the catcher! Hafeez has pulled off a stunning one-hander to his right. This was a quicker ball on off stump, Mutumbami plants an open face down on it and it seems like he has eked out an easy single using the pace of the leggie. But Hafeez has stayed low, his reflexes are still sharp and he sticks out the right hand to claim a catch he will remember for a while
nice and tight on middle, Jongwe stays back, does not cover the line but still manages to defend
gets down the track and drives the flighted delivery into the covers
good length ball outside off, Jongwe stays back and blocks to slip
eases down the pitch and drives towards mid-off
tossed up on the pads, Chigumbura steps down the track and clips to deep midwicket. He wants a second, but it is not there. Good call from Jongwe to send his captain back

plumb in front! Malik has been bowling a few too many down leg. This time though he has tossed the ball up just outside off, it turns rather sharply too. Hits Jonwe below the knee-roll on the pad before his bat can come down in time. Looked very bad for the batsman and it was
takes the flighted delivery on the full as he runs down the track and pushes down to long-on
stays back to a flattish delivery on leg stump and picks it away towards long leg. Chigumbura wants a second run, ignoring the risk of a run out. Cremer is sensible enough to say no though
pushed through on the pads, Cremer clips it past midiwcket
a little width outside off, Chigumbura makes some room of his own as well and taps it just behind point
thats a good shot, always lovely to watch an extra cover drive. NIpped down the pitch, stayed beside the ball and hit it all along the ground

looked for the covers again, but this time he could not reach the pitch. Yasir gets the ball to turn and take the outside edge. Goes well past the slip fielder, and backward point had no chance either
planted that front pad on off stump and inside edges into the leg side. Had that gone on with the arm a bit more, we could have had another pretty strong lbw shout
sneaks in a googly on off stump, Chigumbura whips it through midwicket

five-for! Another lazy little hit across the line by a Zimbabwe batsman coming down the track. Chigumbura has not reached the pitch, which means the ball has enough time to turn, take the outside edge and settle in the hands of cover
huge appeal from the keeper, and then a wry smile. This was quick, flat and outside off. Panyangara goes for a cut, has not connected
way down leg again, Cremer steps down the track and picks it to midwicket

huge lbw appeal from the bowler, and it seems to be only him asking for it. But the ump agrees! Cremer goes for a reverse sweep. Pulled into that shot because Malik was frustrating him with darts on leg stump. Has not make any connection and is stuck on the thigh pad in front of leg stump. Considering the turn Malik is getting I am not sure that would have hit
short and just outside off, chopped into the covers by Nyumbu
good length ball on off stump, defended
tossed up on leg stump, Panyangara goes for an ungainly sweep. Gets to him quicker than he expected and is struck on the pad. Appeal again, but this time it is not given. Would have gone down leg
sweep connects and how! This is a length ball and Panyangara has simply swatted it away to the square leg boundary
googly, but Nyumbu seems to have picked it. Leans forward and blocks into the covers
premeditated the lap sweep, which gave Yasir all the warning he needed. Bowls flatter and well outside off to foil the stroke
another big lbw appeal as Yasir fires one in full and at leg stump. Panyangara looks to defend but he is doing it down the wrong line. Tight shout, but the umpire things that would be slipping down
lifted over mid-off
fired down the leg side, strikes his pad sooner than he could get his bat down.

and there it is. Zimbabwe are done. Another good length ball, which gets a little more bounce than normal. Panyangara goes for a pull, seems to have gotten a little bit of glove to pop a catch to slip
